intro: Textoria trifida, commonly known as the three-lobed thistle, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features a spiny, cylindrical stem with narrow, gray-green leaves that have three distinct lobes. Its flowers are yellow and appear in late summer, attracting various pollinators. Textoria trifida is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
